abstract.p: Police investigate two pipe-bomb explosions beneath parked cars in Woodhaven, Queens, causing minor damage but no injuries (S)

block.p: The police yesterday were investigating two pipe-bomb explosions beneath parked cars in Woodhaven, Queens, that caused minor damage to the vehicles but no injuries.

The first bomb went off at about 2 a.m. Thursday, under a gold 1990 Honda parked at 95-13 93rd Street, the police said. The second bomb exploded at about 10:50 p.m. Thursday, under a black Hyundai parked at the corner of 81st Street and 97th Avenue, the police said. There was no one in either car when the bombs went off, the police said.
The police yesterday were investigating two pipe-bomb explosions beneath parked cars in Woodhaven, Queens, that caused minor damage to the vehicles but no injuries.

The first bomb went off at about 2 a.m. Thursday, under a gold 1990 Honda parked at 95-13 93rd Street, the police said. The second bomb exploded at about 10:50 p.m. Thursday, under a black Hyundai parked at the corner of 81st Street and 97th Avenue, the police said. There was no one in either car when the bombs went off, the police said.
Materials used to make the bombs, which were constructed with pipes about 12 inches long, were still being analyzed yesterday by the Police Department's bomb squad, officials said.
There was no apparent connection between the two cars, which were parked 12 blocks apart, the police said, and detectives said the incidents appeared to be random.
